title: Ticket #6020: condor-c and jobRouter should delete TotalSubmitProcs
description:
When you submit a job to an 8.5.7 Schedd it injects an attribute TotalSubmitProcs and sets it's value to the number of ProcId 's in that ClusterId. This attribute is used by condor_q -batch to calculate the total number of jobs and the number of jobs that have completed and left the queue.

So if a job is transformed by condor-c or by the job router and turned into a bunch of single procid jobs, this attribute need to be stripped by condor-c or the job router when submitting to a schedd that is older than 8.5.7. Otherwise condor_q can report wildly inaccurate values for total jobs in a batch.

There is no harm in having these tools always remove that attribute.
remarks:
2016-Nov-23 12:35:59 by johnkn:
According to Jaime. the relevant functions to fix up are: 

   condor_gridmanager/condorjob.cpp: CondorJob::buildSubmitAd()
   condor_job_router/VanillaToGrid.cpp: VanillaToGrid::vanillaToGrid()
